DOC.HEADLINE: Lippi calm before Italy ' s World Cup opener

TEXT.P: Italy coach Marcello Lippi didn't make any bold predictions before the Azzurri's World Cup victory four years ago, and he certainly wasn't about to change his ways before Monday's opener with Paraguay.
Great teams are "born" at tournaments like the World Cup "and grow game by game," Lippi said Sunday, calling the rampant skepticism surrounding his aging squad "normal."
Amid numerous questions, Lippi gave no indications of his lineup, but promised his team would attack the South Americans.
Paraguay could be Italy's toughest opponent in Group F, which also features New Zealand and Slovakia.
